intro: Jasione cavanillesii, commonly known as the rock Jasione, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial herb with hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, contributing to its drought-resistant characteristics. Jasione cavanillesii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
